reviews.sentence: Tired and pretentious. The location is great if you want to be in the heart of the cove. However the hotel is old and the last renovation must have been some time ago. The front staff is a little overly snooty especially Cesar. Our room was not ready when we arrived at 4 pm and was not ready until after 5 pm. They gave us a 25 credit for our wait but gave us no way to use it. When we tried to receive the credit at the restaurant they did not know anything about it. Shortly after we arrived they came for turn down service. I had not been in the room for more than 30 minutes. The cleaning staff is also way understaffed or really slow. They came to our room at nearly 5 pm the next day to make the beds. We had been gone all day and were just showering preparing to go out. The only good thing you get at this hotel is location.

Great price location. Overall a great place for the rates in La Jola. However do not expect luxurious accommodations. It looks like they have invested more in updating the common area than the rooms. Our bathroom needed a complete remodel and the room could use an aesthetic updating. Also the television was oddly positioned at a heigh lower than that of the bed.

Old and tired. just average. I have to say I was a little disappointed in all the TA reviews here as I booked this hotel solely on those reviews. Honestly this is a very tired hotel with small rooms that smell like your grandmother died in them tiny bathrooms and a small screen TV that can not be swung out at a proper angle to watch TV in bed. There are very few outlets for a modern business traveler to plus all his electronics into. They do not have coffee available for free downstairs and getting your car takes 15 minutes even when you call. The elevator looks like it was last renovated in the 1930s. Sure the lobby looks nice but do not be fooled. Just pass and look for something else.

Grand Colonial in La Jola. A great old hotel. Accommodations were above average but our bathroom needed some serious updating. There was no counter space at all. They could modernize the bathrooms and still maintain the feel of 1913. The staff was terrific Very friendly and helpful.

Great hotel for a San Diego vacation. The CotageBoboiOperacafeBrick BelTaco StandWe stayed at Grande Colonial for 4 nights. It was an excellent choice for our San Diego location. LOCATION the location is simply perfect. It has great ocean views and is one block away from the beach and ocean. The area just has a nice feel to it with wide streets and just the right amount of people does n’t feel crowded. The great thing is that are a ton of well regarded restaurants in the direct area. You have everything from breakfast to Thai to pizza. There is also a lot of shopping within walking distance. So if you want to you can just walk to everything and not have to worry about driving or Uber. We also considered staying in Gaslamp Quarter but are so happy we decided on La Jola instead. Gaslamp is nice but just feels like any major city ’s downtown. La Jola has the laid back safe and beautiful feel to it. Also the attractions like the Zoo and Balboa Park are less than 25 min away. ROM we upgraded to a junior suite with full ocean view. The windows were huge and gave us a direct view of the water which is always a nice bonus. As for the actual room itself we were n’t very impressed. Keep in mind this is a hotel built in 1913 so even with renovations it wo n’t feel modern. The bathrooms were a big disappointment with small round toilets and low showerheads. Also our room had no door separating the toilet and the vanity area and there was no mirror outside of the bathroom. The air conditioning was also weak. We kept it at 65 degrees every night but it felt more like 73 or 74On the bright side the beds were super comfortable and they had good quality Gilchrist Soames toiletries. Service was very good. Overall we had a great stay at Grande Colonial. This would be a top choice if you care more about location than having a modern luxurious room.

Great staff in classic hotel rooms need updating. Was a nice stay though the room was a bit dated and on the smaller side. Size would not have mattered so much if the in room amenities were a bit more updated including the On Demand feature on the TV which should not be a big deal given that we were on vacation but on vacation with small children who every now and then just need to watch a little Curious George.

Great Location and Staff But Needs An Overhaul. The staff are wonderful breakfast is great and a very convenient location. Unfortunately the rooms need a major overhaul. Ideally they should expand the rooms sizes but that may not be feasible but at a minimum the carpet needs to be changed it is old stained and smells the furniture and bedding changed and the bathrooms are old broken and no place for toiletries as they tend to fall off the small glass ledge and into the toilet. Until they do an massive overhaul suggest the La Valencia a block away.

Great Location and Staff But Needs An Overhaul. The staff are wonderful breakfast is great and a very convenient location. Unfortunately the rooms need a major overhaul. Ideally they should expand the rooms sizes but that may not be feasible but at a minimum the carpet needs to be changed it is old stained and smells the furniture and bedding changed and the bathrooms are old broken and no place for toiletries as they tend to fall off the small glass ledge and into the toilet. Until they do an massive overhaul suggest the La Valencia a block away.

The Hotel is charming. Much like a favorite European Hotel. Food in the restaurant excellent. The staff fabulous. They were in the midst of remodeling some areas which created a couple small problems. My bed was not comfortable. But everything was cleanand walking along the the walkway aside the beach just a a block away was heavenly.

Quick weekend stay. I came to La Jola after a week in downtown San Diego. This hotel is going through a renovation but the rooms have not yet undergone any facelifts. The rooms are old as expected but comfortable. The bathroom lacks counter space and you needed to lock the door to keep the bathroom door shut. The room had a somewhat of a stale scent but the windows are operable i did not open them but there is the option. The room had a great size for 2 even with a room with 2 queen beds. There was a nice desk and a nice sitting chair. The television was large and visible from the bed. The renovation is necessary and will be very welcomed. The room service was EXCELLENT and there is even a complimentary turn down service. When checking in the front desk males were not as friendly as the females. However everyone was very good at their jobs. I really enjoyed this hotel and you can tell everyone that works there takes pride in their jobs. I have already recommended this to my friends in person and via social media. I would love to be able to visit this hotel again once the hotel has been renovated. The hotel is so close to all there is to see in La Jola so stay here for a weekend of romance or sightseeing or both. Also many kudos to the excellent service by the valet.

Awesome hotel upgrade fantastic location. I have been staying here multiple times a year for the past five years. it is a great hotel and a great experience. The newly renovated rooms are terrific and have been well planned out love the colour schemes. The hotel restaurant is also terrific with a great menu and consistently tasty food options.

Absolutely beautiful. Beautiful historic facility in ideal location. We stayed in one of the renovated cottages which was ideal. The courtyard is beautiful and relaxing. The location is ideal as you so close the restaurants and La Jola Cove.

Breathtaking View. Absolutely stunning. I have always been a fan of the Grande Colonial. The newly renovated hotel is crisp and clean with traditonal mixed with contemporary. Well done. All of the staff members were professional and friendly. Had brunch at Nine Ten. Food was delicious. Eggs and bacon cooked to perfection not an easy feat given the fact it was Mothers Day. Looking forward to our next stay.
Great location comfortable room beautiful renovation. Location was perfect. Great combination of new renovation with old world building. Loved It. Would have liked tea bags to be in the room.

Great Location. Great Hotel. We were most pleased with our stay at the renovated Grande Colonial. Location is central to most everything. No need to hassle with parking. Rooms are spacious and very upscale. Staff attends to your every need. Little details such as flavored water pitchers in the lobby are nice. The restaurant is very good and foodie oriented. They brought a special full length mirror for my wife at her request among other things. They really went out of their way. Only negative the pool is on the smallish size but crystal clean with plenty of towels available from open to close.

Great stay. Great stay. Friendly staff. Great location. Valet parking very attentive and efficient. The swimming pool is nicely placed and overhauled. There is a gym one block away with all necessary amenities free of charge for the hotel clients. There is a very good restaurant with friendly staff.

Family trip. Great location old hotel that needs updating. We liked it overall but needs hot tub and better amenitiesdid not try restaurant but liked bar and lobby area. Quiet for where it is but very sad they built condo to block views.

The Grande Colonial. As my second stay I had the opportunity to explore the Grande Colonial a bit more and certainly appreciated the personalized gesture waiting for me at the reception desk thank you Raelene. I enjoyed the updated room and incredible ocean view. Lastly I have to compliment the in house restaurant NINE TEN. The food was delicious and the restaurant is certainly worthy of staying on property and making a reservation. Thank you Grande Colonial.
Tasteful low key décor of the room with updated bathroom facilities not to mention the lovely view.

Historic Gem in Heart of La Jola. We had an exceptional stay at the Grande. The hotels history is amazing and while an historic building the rooms were completely updated. The best of the past and present. Service was very good as well. The hotel is right in the heart of La Jola perfect for walking everywhere. We had breakfast at the hotel in the restaurant. It was very good but the service was even better. Highly recommended.
